lines.text: My name is Sammy Brown and I just came into town. Saw your ad, you're Mr. Lee. Say, you can make a mint on me.
What do you do?
Dance, sing.
Play a role?
Anything. Say, I'm a find for guys like you, cause there's nothing I can't do.
Tell me, where did you work before?
In a department store.
Who told you you could dance and sing?
For money, I'll do anything.
I need a drink.
Alright, I'll take a drink.
You'll take the air!
The air he cries!
I no like the air. It's too cold outside.
I played a part in Ben Hur once.
What part did you play, sir?
A girl, she played the part of Ben.
And you?
I played her.
I want to play a dramatic part, the kind that touch a woman's heart, to make her cry for me to die ...
Did you ever get hit with a cocoanuts pie?

[To Tomalio]
That's my argument. Restrict immigration.

[After the Merchant of Wieners performs]
Well, what do you think?
I wouldn't give him a dollar a week.
Not so loud. He'll take it.

[After Caesar's Ghost performs]
Give me a brick!

[Hands Mr. Lee a brick]
Here's a brick. I always carry one for this imitation.
Say, I ought to lay this on your head!
You can't do that - you don't belong to my bricklayer's union!
This isn't Monkey Business.
[reading a note from The Merchant of Wieners]
My name is What-Do-You-Care, my home is anywhere. People say I'm awful dumb, so I thought to you I'd come.
Now, just a moment, wait a minute. He might be crazy. Wait, I'll find out. You wanna go on the stage?
[The Merchant of Wieners nods]
Crazy.
